title: Log Management - Estimated Usage
description:
This dashboard aims to give you insights into the Datadog Log Management estimated usage metrics.

See the [Log Management documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/) to learn more about the product.

See the [Log Management pricing page](https://www.datadoghq.com/pricing/?product=log-management#log-management) to learn more about the different plans available.

definition.content:
# Get detailed insights into your log usage and volumes.

[Product Page 竊余(https://www.datadoghq.com/product/log-management/)
| [Docs 竊余(https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/) | [Configuration 竊余(https://app.datadoghq.com/logs/pipelines)

[Guide: Monitor your log usage 竊余(https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/guide/logs-monitors-on-volumes/)

Tip: Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify and add widgets and visualizations.

*Empty dashboard?* [Start](https://docs.datadoghq.com/getting_started/logs/) collecting logs today!

definition.title: Contribution % to the amount of logs ingested per service
Contribution % to the amount of logs ingested per service

Contribution % to the amount of bytes ingested per service

% of excluded logs for the top 10 and bottom 10 services

definition.content:
This scatter plot displays the amount of logs ingested vs the combined size of those logs in bytes for each one of your service.

The more a service is in the upper right corner the more it might impact your ingestion costs as it means it's ingesting lots of logs and the combined size of all those logs is "very big"

definition.title: Number of logs vs Size of logs per service

definition.content:
This scatter plot displays the ratio of logs indexed vs the overall amount of logs ingested per service

The more a service is in the upper right corner the more it might impact your indexation costs as it means it's indexing a high % of logs from an elevated amount of logs ingested

definition.title: % of logs being indexed per service vs # of logs ingested
